page.title: 17Menwith Hill Station
page.content: The base at Menwith Hill is a joint U.S./M.O.D. communications station covering 545 rented acres of high moorland, built 25 years ago, originally for the U.S. Army, but now civilianised (1966) and staffed jointly by U.S. and British civil servants and U.S. contractor personnel. It is the only U.S. Defense Department installation in the U.K. managed by civilians. There are about three thousand people associated with the station, including a substantial number of U.S. families resident both on the base and in the surrounding areas.
